combat-superiority.description: You learn maneuvers that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.

maneuvers.description: You learn three maneuvers of your choice. Many maneuvers enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one maneuver per attack.
maneuvers.details: Each time you learn new maneuvers, you can also replace one maneuver you know with a different one.

combat-superiority.save-dc: 8 + proficiency bonus + Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice)

student-of-war.description: You gain proficiency with one type of artisan's tools of your choice.

know-your-enemy.description: If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own.
know-your-enemy.details: The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

improved-combat-superiority.description: Your superiority dice turn into d10s. At 18th level, they turn into d12s.

relentless.description: When you roll initiative and have no superiority dice remaining, you regain 1 superiority die.
